text: Pharoah Sanders (born Farrell Sanders; October 13, 1940 – September 24, 2022) was an American jazz saxophonist. Saxophonist Ornette Coleman once called him as "probably the best tenor player in the world." In 1968 he participated in Michael Mantler and Carla Bley's Jazz Composer's Orchestra Association album The Jazz Composer's Orchestra, featuring Cecil Taylor, Don Cherry, Larry Coryell and Gato Barbieri. Sanders died on September 24, 2022, at his home in Los Angeles at the age of 81. ==References== ==Other websites== * – official site Category:1940 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American jazz musicians Category:American saxophonists Category:Musicians from Little Rock, Arkansas
title: Pharoah Sanders
